item.title: Remembering the Aqua Hotel Las Vegas: A Strip History of Change and Continuity
item.description:
A Humble Beginning: The Home Motel and the Ashes of 1941

Before the neon glow of the Aqua Hotel, before the Shalimar even, the land at 1401 South Las Vegas Boulevard held a simpler story. In the late 1930s, it was home to the Home Motel, a small auto-court â€“ a classic feature of early Las Vegas, catering to travelers arriving by car. This was a time when the Strip was still finding its feet, a burgeoning route of roadside businesses and simple lodgings. Sadly, that early chapter was cut short. A devastating fire ripped through the Home Motel in October 1941, leaving little but ashes and a need for rebuilding.
